page.title: 15PLACE NAMES ORIGINS
page.content:
{HIGHNAM:}"The monks' Hamm"_Land belonging to a homestead owned by Gloucester Abbey. {BULLEY :}Pasture for bullocks (still a livestock farm in 1985) {TIBBERTON:}The TUN or homestead and enclosure of TIDBEORHT'S people. {LASSINGTON:}Again TUN or homestead, possibly with a personal name or "laessa" meaning smaller. {RODWAY HILL:}Perhaps from dialect word "royd" _a clearing in the forest. {RIVER LEADON:}British river name meaning broad. {RUDFORD:}Possibly reedy ford.
Other links with the monks are "Prior's wood" and "Demesne wood".
